se.idsec.signservice.security.sign

Interface SignatureValidator<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of document that is validated

    public interface SignatureValidator<T>
    Generic interface representing a signature validator instance that supports validating documents having one more signatures.
    Author:
    Martin Lindstr√∂m (martin@idsec.se), Stefan Santesson (stefan@idsec.se)

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      CertificateValidator getCertificateValidator()
      Gets the certificate validator instance that is to be used to validate the signer certificate up until a trusted path.
      List<X509Certificate> getRequiredSignerCertificates()
      Gets a list of "required signer certificates", meaning that we require the signature to be signed with a certificate from this list.
      boolean isSigned(T document)
      Predicate that tells if the supplied document is signed.
      List<SignatureValidationResult> validate(T document)
      Validates the signature(s) of supplied document.

    • Method Detail

      • validate

        List<SignatureValidationResult> validate(T document)
                                  throws SignatureException
        Validates the signature(s) of supplied document.
        Parameters:
        document - the document to validate
        Returns:
        a validation result containing the details from a signature validation
        Throws:
        SignatureException - for errors during the validation process (pure signature validation errors are reported in the returned result)

      • isSigned

        boolean isSigned(T document)
          throws IllegalArgumentException
        Predicate that tells if the supplied document is signed.
        Parameters:
        document - the document to check
        Returns:
        true if the document is signed, and false otherwise
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the document can not be parsed

      • getRequiredSignerCertificates

        List<X509Certificate> getRequiredSignerCertificates()
        Gets a list of "required signer certificates", meaning that we require the signature to be signed with a certificate from this list.

        If an empty list is returned this means that a complete certificate path validation up to a trusted root will be performed (provided getCertificateValidator() is non null). If no certificate validator is installed the signature will be accepted without checking any certificates (provided that the signature itself is valid).

        Returns:
        a (possibly empty) list of "accepted" certificates

      • getCertificateValidator

        CertificateValidator getCertificateValidator()
        Gets the certificate validator instance that is to be used to validate the signer certificate up until a trusted path.

        If getRequiredSignerCertificates() returns a non-empty list, no certificate path validation will be performed.

        If no certificate validator is configured the signature will be accepted without checking any certificates (provided that the signature itself is valid).

        Returns:
        the certificate validator or null
